newsitem.title: USA: Arkansas soy planting advances despite rain.
newsitem.headline: Arkansas soy planting advances despite rain.

text.p: Soybean planting in Arkansas advanced despite interruption by scattered rain showers during the week ended Sunday, acccording to the state's weekly Agricultural Statistics Service.
Soybeans were 52 percent planted and 38 emerged versus 52 and 38 a year ago, and the 42 and 27 averages. The crop improved to five percent excellent, 51 good, 42 fair and two poor.
Corn was 100 percent planted. The crop condition improved to eight percent excellent, 56 good, 32 fair and four poor.
Soft red winter wheat was 100 percent headed, the same as a week ago, and the condition was mostly unchanged at four percent excellent, 28 good, 46 fair, 20 poor and two very poor.
Rice was 98 percent planted and 90 emerged versus 97 and 92 a year ago, and the 95 and 86 averages. The crop improved to 14 percent excellent, 43 good, 35 fair, seven poor and one very poor.
Soil moisture was rated 27 percent surplus, 55 adequate, 17 short, and one very short.
